00032 /*
00033  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00034  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00035  *
00036  * lustre/fld/fld_internal.h
00037  *
00038  * Subsystem Description:
00039  * FLD is FID Location Database, which stores where (IE, on which MDT)
00040  * FIDs are located.
00041  * The database is basically a record file, each record consists of a FID
00042  * sequence range, MDT/OST index, and flags. The FLD for the whole FS
00043  * is only stored on the sequence controller(MDT0) right now, but each target
00044  * also has its local FLD, which only stores the local sequence.
00045  *
00046  * The FLD subsystem usually has two tasks:
00047  * 1. maintain the database, i.e. when the sequence controller allocates
00048  * new sequence ranges to some nodes, it will call the FLD API to insert the
00049  * location information <sequence_range, node_index> in FLDB.
00050  *
00051  * 2. Handle requests from other nodes, i.e. if client needs to know where
00052  * the FID is located, if it can not find the information in the local cache,
00053  * it will send a FLD lookup RPC to the FLD service, and the FLD service will
00054  * look up the FLDB entry and return the location information to client.
00055  *
00056  * Author: Yury Umanets <umka@clusterfs.com>
00057  * Author: Tom WangDi <wangdi@clusterfs.com>
00058  */
00059 #ifndef __FLD_INTERNAL_H
00060 #define __FLD_INTERNAL_H

00068         __u64   fst_count;
00069         __u64   fst_cache;

00075 (*fld_scan_func_t) (struct lu_client_fld *, __u64);

00089 };

00091 struct fld_cache {
00096         rwlock_t                 fci_lock;
00097 
00100         int                      fci_threshold;
00101 
00104         int                      fci_cache_size;
00105 
00108         int                      fci_cache_count;
00109 
00112         struct list_head        fci_lru;
00113 
00116         struct list_head        fci_entries_head;
00117 
00120         struct fld_stats         fci_stat;
00121 
00124         char                     fci_name[80];
00125         unsigned int             fci_no_shrink:1;
00126 };
00127 
00128 enum {
00129         /* 4M of FLD cache will not hurt client a lot. */
00130         FLD_SERVER_CACHE_SIZE      = (4 * 0x100000),
00131 
00132         /* 1M of FLD cache will not hurt client a lot. */
00133         FLD_CLIENT_CACHE_SIZE      = (1 * 0x100000)
00134 };
00135 
00136 enum {
00137         /* Cache threshold is 10 percent of size. */
00138         FLD_SERVER_CACHE_THRESHOLD = 10,
00139 
00140         /* Cache threshold is 10 percent of size. */
00141         FLD_CLIENT_CACHE_THRESHOLD = 10
00142 };

00229 static inline const char *
00230 fld_target_name(const struct lu_fld_target *tar)
00231 {
00232 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00233         if (tar->ft_srv != NULL)
00234                 return tar->ft_srv->lsf_name;
00235 #endif
00236 
00237         return tar->ft_exp->exp_obd->obd_name;
00238 }
